No actions are taken yet—this is the opening round and narrative setup. Prerolled dice sets are available for all non-player characters and monsters. Awaiting Scout Kira's turn to begin the action. Player (Eirik) will act third in initiative after Kira and Bandit_2.",
  "narration": "A chill wind spirals across the ruined hilltop, scattering mist and glinting on the battered stones of the North Tower Overlook. The first pale rays of dawn slice through the morning haze as you and Kira take a careful breath, surveying the battlefield.

Suddenly, movement among the rubble—a shadowy figure rises, bow drawn, eyes narrowed beneath a soiled bandana. Another emerges from behind a half-collapsed wall, clutching a rusty scimitar. These are no lost travelers, but hardened bandit sentinels—faces grim, posture ready, clearly determined to reclaim this ruined stronghold for their mysterious masters.

Scout Kira’s green eyes flick your way, a slight nod of trust passing between comrades. You count your breaths, adrenaline sharpening every sense as the hostile pair fan out, blocking any retreat and readying to strike.

The battle lines are drawn atop the ancient stones. In the dim light of dawn, with wounded pride and wounded bodies, you and Kira stand against the bandit threat. Steel is about to clash—and the fate of the tower, for now, lies in your hands.

Initiative order is set: Kira acts first, then the second bandit, then you, Eirik, with the last bandit closing out the round. The ruins around you hold their breath as combat begins.",

  "narration": "Kira’s gasp sharpens your focus—the sight of blood, the threat of losing another friend, brings a flash of memory from those brutal days with your unit. She stumbles but keeps her blade ready as Bandit_2 stands over her with a look of cruel triumph. The second bandit tightens his grip on a crossbow, angling for a clean shot.

The overlook crackles with tension. The wind tugs at your tabard, the earth feeling cold and unyielding beneath your boots. Only decisive action will keep Kira on her feet, or buy the seconds you need to turn the tide.

Scout Kira is badly wounded. Bandit_2 is just a stride away, pressing the attack. The second bandit lingers near the rubble, eyeing you with clear intent to join the brawl.

You have your shield, your mace, and the power of faith at your fingertips, Eirik. The fight for the tower is here.

Your sword-arm is steady, but your heart pounds with urgency. What action do you take?",

{
  "plan": "Round 1, Eirik's turn. Player is considering healing magic for critically wounded Kira (1/10 HP). Both 'Cure Wounds' and 'Healing Word' are viable at this moment. Provide concise, player-facing guidance: Cure Wounds requires touch and uses an action, but heals more; Healing Word has shorter healing but is a bonus action with 60 ft. range. After the player chooses, prompt for relevant spell details and roll (1d8+3 for Cure Wounds, 1d4+3 for Healing Word) and describe that Disciple of Life will grant extra healing. Bandit still has turn remaining this round.",
  "narration": "You call out for guidance, recalling your training:

Cure Wounds is a potent healing spell, but you must lay a hand on Kira and spend your full action—its restorative power draws from your devotion and heals (at first level) 1d8 + your Wisdom modifier, plus an extra boost from your Life Domain. It’s the best option when you can spare the time and are within arm’s reach.

Healing Word, by contrast, lets you speak a blessing from afar—anywhere within sixty feet. It’s a swift bonus action, but it restores slightly less (1d4 + Wisdom modifier, plus your divine bonus). This spell lets you heal and still swing your mace or cast another cantrip.

Both spells trigger your Life Domain’s gift, mending extra wounds each time you heal: 2 + the spell’s level (so +3 more for either, at first level).

Kira locks eyes with you—there’s sweat and pain on her brow, but hope and stubborn courage as well. The bandits prowl only a step away.

You stand ready, faith humming at your fingertips. What is your choice of healing, or do you strike back instead?",

}

On hit, player must also roll 1d6+2 for bludgeoning damage. Bandit (initiative 3) will act after, ending round 1.",
  "narration": "You raise your shield and shout a prayer, divine light spilling from your lips. A wave of warm radiance knits Kira’s wounds, strength returning to her limbs. She grins fiercely, rallying with new hope as the bandit still looms overhead.

As the magic fades, you charge in, mace swinging toward Bandit_2. The bandit sees the gleam in your eyes—soldier’s resolve and protector’s fury—in the cold dawn.

First, roll 1d4 and add your Wisdom modifier (+3) and your Life Domain bonus (+3) for Kira’s healing. Then, roll a d20 and add 4 for your mace attack against Bandit_2 (his AC is 12). If you hit, roll 1d6+2 for damage.

Let faith and steel do their work, Eirik!",
